Try to be very rational and honest with yourself and towards your work or studies. Never assume, unless you are deliberately theoretizing. Check facts. Do not “believe” but “make sure”. Don’t judge in a superficial manner. Check and double check. Ask for peer review/opinion. Show humility. Realize that the more you learn the less you know as more and more things come into view that you are ignorant about. Realize that only certain aspects of knowledge may open to you but of that you will possess thorough understanding. Let your knowledge be shaped by new understanding entering the field. Don’t accept it blindly but also don’t dismiss it off hand smugly. If you can do this, you can be one of the most knowledgeable in the field of your choice. Albeit it’s part of honesty and humility: don’t forget to acknoledge other’s works. Finding valuable works is just as valuable as coming up with them.

Try to read some popular science articles and websites in your free time instead of browsing your facebook feed, watching tv series etc. It will “improve your science”, but it won’t be too boring to be made on regular basis and you won’t get discouraged too quickly. Remember, cosequence is the key to success!

To improve scientific understanding, first step is to ask questions. Question about everything you come across. Inculcate the habit of asking questions, particularly ‘why’ type questions. Also, don’t just stop with questioning. You also have to try to find out the answers yourself if you are not getting satisfactory answers from anyone. Remember, first step of learning is to know what we don’t know.
